p: The results showed that ethnicity (Yi (OR = 31.030, 95% CI: 11.643–82.694) compared to Han), education level (primary school (OR = 5.393, 95% CI: 1.285–22.633) compared to Illiteracy), and HIV transmission routes (intravenous drug use (OR = 134.024, 95% CI: 14.328–1253.653), intravenous drug use + history of non-married heterosexual contact (OR = 242.534, 95% CI: 10.053–5851.304) and others (OR = 59.696, 95% CI: 6.136–580.787) compared to homosexual transmission) were the risk factors for HCV infection in HIV-positive individuals ( Table 4).
